title: RUST_BACKTRACE=1 segfaults on locally compiled programs

labels.name: I-crash
labels.description: Issue: The compiler crashes (SIGSEGV, SIGABRT, etc). Use I-ICE instead when the compiler panics.

labels.name: A-debuginfo
labels.description: Area: Debugging information in compiled programs (DWARF, PDB, etc.)

body:
`RUST_BACKTRACE=1` segfaults on locally compiled programs when they panic. Externally built binaries such as those installed through rustup work as expected, yielding the ICE backtrace in #44858 .

I use [Exherbo Linux](https://exherbo.org). I can use `-C panic=abort` to get traces from `gdb`, but that forbids anything graceful.

```rust
fn main() {
  panic!("test")
}
```
```
thread 'main' panicked at 'test', segfault.rs:2:4
Segmentation fault (core dumped)
```
